intro: Chrysopsis nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its small, delicate flowers bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chrysopsis nervosa is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid regions.
